alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lincoln, northeastern Oklahoma, southeastern Logan and south central Payne Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1026 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chandler, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Perkins, Prague, Davenport, Wellston, Carney, Tryon, Agra, Sparks, Warwick, Kendrick, Fallis and Parkland. Those attending outdoor events in northern Lincoln County are in the path of this storm and should prepare for thunderstorm impacts. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 153 and 177. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
